channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Concentrated sets and the Hurewicz property
item.description: arXiv:2511.09320v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A set of reals $X$ is $\mathfrak{b}$-concentrated if it has cardinality at least $\mathfrak{b}$ and it contains a countable set $D\subseteq X$ such that each closed subset of $X$ disjoint with $D$ has size smaller than $\mathfrak{b}$. We present ZFC results about structures of $\mathfrak{b}$-concentrated sets with the Hurewicz covering property using semifilters. Then we show that assuming that the semifilter trichotomy holds, then each $\mathfrak{b}$-concentrated set is Hurewicz and even productively Hurewicz. We also show that the appearance of Hurewicz $\mathfrak{b}$-concentrated sets under the semifilter trichotomy is somewhat specific and the situation in the Laver model for the consitency of the Borel Conjecture is different.
item.dc:creator: Valentin Haberl, Piotr Szewczak, Lyubomyr Zdomskyy

item.title: The Complexity of Proper Homotopy Equivalence of Graphs
item.description: arXiv:2410.00901v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We demonstrate that the proper homotopy equivalence relation for locally finite graphs is Borel complete. Furthermore, among the infinite graphs, there is a comeager equivalence class. As corollaries, we obtain the analogous results for the homeomorphism relation of noncompact surfaces with pants decompositions.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Hoganson, Jenna Zomback
